 2464: 
 2465:     39679005 = erlang:phash2(#{}),
 2466:     33667975 = erlang:phash2(#{ a => 1, "a" => 2, <<"a">> => 3, {a,b} => 4 }), % 78942764
 2467:     95332690 = erlang:phash2(#{ 1 => a, 2 => "a", 3 => <<"a">>, 4 => {a,b} }), % 37338230

 2469:     59617982 = erlang:phash2(#{ a => 1 }), % 51612236

 2498:     2927531828 = erlang:phash(#{ 1 => a },Sz), % 1394238263

 2500: 
 2501:     3935089469 = erlang:phash(#{{} => <<>>},Sz), % 1578050717
 2502:     71692856   = erlang:phash(#{<<>> => {}},Sz), % 1578050717
 2503:

 2506:     M2 = M1#{ "key" => <<"value">> },

 2510:     2620391445 = erlang:phash(M2,Sz), % 3590546636

 2513:     1945662653 = erlang:phash(M1000, Sz),
 2514:

 2516:     113694495 = erlang:phash(Mnested1, Sz),
 2517:

 2519:     431825783 = erlang:phash(Mnested2, Sz),

 2522: 
 2523: t_map_encode_decode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2524:     <<131,116,0,0,0,0>> = erlang:term_to_binary(#{}),
 2525:     Pairs = [
 2526: 	{a,b},{"key","values"},{<<"key">>,<<"value">>},
 2527: 	{1,b},{[atom,1],{<<"wat">>,1,2,3}},
 2528: 	{aa,"values"},
 2529: 	{1 bsl 64 + (1 bsl 50 - 1), sc1},
 2530: 	{99, sc2},
 2531: 	{1 bsl 65 + (1 bsl 51 - 1), sc3},
 2532: 	{88, sc4},
 2533: 	{1 bsl 66 + (1 bsl 52 - 1), sc5},
 2534: 	{77, sc6},
 2535: 	{1 bsl 67 + (1 bsl 53 - 1), sc3},
 2536: 	{75, sc6}, {-10,sc8},
 2537: 	{<<>>, sc9}, {3.14158, sc10},
 2538: 	{[3.14158], sc11}, {more_atoms, sc12},
 2539: 	{{more_tuples}, sc13}, {self(), sc14},
 2540: 	{{},{}},{[],[]},
 2541:         {map_s, #{a=>a, 2=>b, 3=>c}},
 2542:         {map_l, maps:from_list([{I,I}||I <- lists:seq(1,74)])}
 2543:     ],
 2544:     ok = map_encode_decode_and_match(Pairs,[],#{}),
 2545: 
 2546:     %% check sorting
 2547: 
 2548:     %% literally #{ b=>2, a=>1 } in the internal order
 2549:     #{ a:=1, b:=2 } =
 2550: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,2,100,0,1,98,97,2,100,0,1,97,97,1>>),
 2551: 
 2552: 
 2553:     %% literally #{ "hi" => "value", a=>33, b=>55 } in the internal order
 2554:     #{ a:=33, b:=55, "hi" := "value"} = erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,3,
 2555: 	107,0,2,104,105,            % "hi" :: list()
 2556: 	107,0,5,118,97,108,117,101, % "value" :: list()
 2557: 	100,0,1,97,                 % a :: atom()
 2558: 	97,33,                      % 33 :: integer()
 2559: 	100,0,1,98,                 % b :: atom()
 2560: 	97,55                       % 55 :: integer()
 2561: 	>>),
 2562: 
 2563:     %% Maps of different sizes
 2564:     lists:foldl(fun(Key, M0) ->
 2565: 			M1 = M0#{Key => Key},
 2566: 			case Key rem 17 of
 2567: 			    0 ->
 2568: 				M1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M1)),
 2569:                                 M1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M1, [deterministic]));
 2570: 			    _ ->
 2571: 				ok
 2572: 			end,
 2573: 			M1
 2574: 		end,
 2575: 		#{},
 2576: 		lists:seq(1,10000)),
 2577: 
 2578:     %% many maps in same binary
 2579:     MapList = lists:foldl(fun(K, [M|_]=Acc) -> [M#{K => K} | Acc] end,
 2580: 			  [#{}],
 2581: 			  lists:seq(1,100)),
 2582:     MapList = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MapList)),
 2583:     MapListR = lists:reverse(MapList),
 2584:     MapListR = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MapListR)),
 2585: 
 2586:     %% error cases
 2587:     %% template: <<131,116,0,0,0,2,100,0,1,97,100,0,1,98,97,1,97,1>>
 2588:     %% which is: #{ a=>1, b=>1 }
 2589: 
 2590:     %% uniqueness violation
 2591:     %% literally #{ a=>1, "hi"=>"value", a=>2 }
 2592:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{_,_,_,_}|_]}} = (catch
 2593: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,3,
 2594: 			       100,0,1,97,
 2595: 			       97,1,
 2596: 			       107,0,2,104,105,
 2597: 			       107,0,5,118,97,108,117,101,
 2598: 			       100,0,1,97,
 2599: 			       97,2>>)),
 2600: 
 2601:     %% bad size (too large)
 2602:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{_,_,_,_}|_]}} = (catch
 2603: 	erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,12,100,0,1,97,97,1,100,0,1,98,97,1>>)),
 2604: 
 2605:     %% bad size (too small) .. should fail just truncate it .. weird.
 2606:     %% possibly change external format so truncated will be #{a:=1}
 2607:     #{ a:=b } = erlang:binary_to_term(<<131,116,0,0,0,1,100,0,1,97,100,0,1,98,97,1,97,1>>),
 2608: 
 2609:     %% specific fannerl (opensource app) binary_to_term error in 18.1
 2610: 
 2611:     #{bias := {1,1,0},
 2612:       bit_fail := 0,
 2613:       connections := #{{2,9}   := _,
 2614:                        {8,14}  := _,
 2615:                        {2,12}  := _,
 2616:                        {5,7}   := _,
 2617:                        {11,16} := _,
 2618:                        {11,15} := _},
 2619:       layers := {5,7,3},
 2620:       network_type := fann_nettype_layer,
 2621:       num_input := 5,
 2622:       num_layers := 3,
 2623:       num_output := 3,
 2624:       rprop_delta_max := _,
 2625:       rprop_delta_min := _,
 2626:       total_connections := 66,
 2627:       total_neurons := 17,
 2628:       train_error_function := fann_errorfunc_tanh,
 2629:       train_stop_function := fann_stopfunc_mse,
 2630:       training_algorithm := fann_train_rprop} = erlang:binary_to_term(fannerl()),
 2631:     ok.
 2632: 
 2633: map_encode_decode_and_match([{K,V}|Pairs], EncodedPairs, M0) ->
 2634:     M1 = maps:put(K,V,M0),
 2635:     B0 = erlang:term_to_binary(M1),
 2636:     Ls = [{erlang:term_to_binary(K), erlang:term_to_binary(V)}|EncodedPairs],
 2637:     ok = match_encoded_map(B0, length(Ls), Ls),
 2638:     %% decode and match it
 2639:     M1 = erlang:binary_to_term(B0),
 2640:     map_encode_decode_and_match(Pairs,Ls,M1);
 2641: map_encode_decode_and_match([],_,_) -> ok.
 2642: 
 2643: match_encoded_map(<<131,116,Size:32,Encoded/binary>>,Size,Items) ->
 2644:     match_encoded_map_stripped_size(Encoded,Items,Items);
 2645: match_encoded_map(_,_,_) -> no_match_size.
 2646: 
 2647: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(<<>>,_,_) -> ok;
 2648: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B0,[{<<131,K/binary>>,<<131,V/binary>>}|Items],Ls) ->
 2649:     Ksz = byte_size(K),
 2650:     Vsz = byte_size(V),
 2651:     case B0 of
 2652: 	<<K:Ksz/binary,V:Vsz/binary,B1/binary>> ->
 2653: 	    match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B1,Ls,Ls);
 2654: 	_ ->
 2655: 	    match_encoded_map_stripped_size(B0,Items,Ls)
 2656:     end;
 2657: match_encoded_map_stripped_size(_,[],_) -> fail.
 2658: 
 2659: 
 2660: t_bif_map_to_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2661:     [] = maps:to_list(#{}),
 2662:     [{a,1},{b,2}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{a=>1,b=>2})),
 2663:     [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{c=>3,a=>1,b=>2})),
 2664:     [{a,1},{b,2},{g,3}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{g=>3,a=>1,b=>2})),
 2665:     [{a,1},{b,2},{g,3},{"c",4}] = lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{g=>3,a=>1,b=>2,"c"=>4})),
 2666:     [{3,v2},{hi,v4},{{hi,3},v5},{"hi",v3},{<<"hi">>,v1}] =
 2667: 	lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{<<"hi">>=>v1,3=>v2,"hi"=>v3,hi=>v4,{hi,3}=>v5})),
 2668: 
 2669:     [{3,v7},{hi,v9},{{hi,3},v10},{"hi",v8},{<<"hi">>,v6}] =
 2670: 	lists:sort(maps:to_list(#{<<"hi">>=>v1,3=>v2,"hi"=>v3,hi=>v4,{hi,3}=>v5,
 2671: 				  <<"hi">>=>v6,3=>v7,"hi"=>v8,hi=>v9,{hi,3}=>v10})),
 2672: 
 2673:     %% error cases
 2674:     do_badmap(fun(T) ->
 2675: 		      {'EXIT', {{badmap,T},_}} =
 2676: 			  (catch maps:to_list(T))
 2677: 	      end),
 2678:     ok.
 2679: 
 2680: 
 2681: t_bif_map_from_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2682:     #{} = maps:from_list([]),
 2683:     A   = maps:from_list([]),
 2684:     0   = erlang:map_size(A),
 2685: 
 2686:     #{a:=1,b:=2}      = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2}]),
 2687:     #{c:=3,a:=1,b:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}]),
 2688:     #{g:=3,a:=1,b:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{b,2},{g,3}]),
 2689: 
 2690:     #{a:=2} = maps:from_list([{a,1},{a,3},{a,2}]),
 2691: 
 2692:     #{ <<"hi">>:=v1,3:=v3,"hi":=v6,hi:=v4,{hi,3}:=v5} =
 2693: 	maps:from_list([{3,v3},{"hi",v6},{hi,v4},{{hi,3},v5},{<<"hi">>,v1}]),
 2694: 
 2695:     #{<<"hi">>:=v6,3:=v8,"hi":=v11,hi:=v9,{hi,3}:=v10} =
 2696: 	maps:from_list([ {{hi,3},v3}, {"hi",v0},{3,v1}, {<<"hi">>,v4}, {hi,v2},
 2697: 	    {<<"hi">>,v6}, {{hi,3},v10},{"hi",v11}, {hi,v9}, {3,v8}]),
 2698: 
 2699:     %% repeated keys (large -> small)
 2700:     Ps1 = [{a,I}|| I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2701:     Ps2 = [{a,I}|| I <- lists:seq(33,64)],
 2702: 
 2703:     M = maps:from_list(Ps1 ++ [{b,1},{c,1}] ++ Ps2),
 2704:     #{ a := 64, b := 1, c := 1 } = M,
 2705: 
 2706:     %% error cases
 2707:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},b]))),
 2708:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},{b,b,3}]))),
 2709:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b},<<>>]))),
 2710:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id([{a,b}|{b,a}]))),
 2711:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id(a))),
 2712:     {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:from_list(id(42))),
 2713:     ok.
 2714: 
 2715: t_bif_map_next(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2716: 
 2717:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 2718: 
 2719:     try
 2720: 
 2721:         none = maps:next(maps:iterator(id(#{}))),
 2722: 
 2723:         verify_iterator(#{}),
 2724:         verify_iterator(#{a => 1, b => 2, c => 3}),
 2725: 
 2726:         %% Use fatmap in order to test iterating in very deep maps
 2727:         FM = fatmap(43),
 2728:         verify_iterator(FM),
 2729: 
 2730:         {'EXIT', {{badmap,[{a,b},b]},_}} = (catch maps:iterator(id([{a,b},b]))),
 2731:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id(a))),
 2732:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([a|FM]))),
 2733:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([1|#{}]))),
 2734:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-1|#{}]))),
 2735:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-1|FM]))),
 2736:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF|FM]))),
 2737:         {'EXIT', {badarg,_}} = (catch maps:next(id([-16#FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF|FM]))),
 2738: 
 2739:         %% This us a whitebox test that the error code works correctly.
 2740:         %% It uses a path for a tree of depth 4 and tries to do next on
 2741:         %% each of those paths.
 2742:         (fun F(0) -> ok;
 2743:              F(N) ->
 2744:                  try maps:next([N|FM]) of
 2745:                      none ->
 2746:                          F(N-1);
 2747:                      {_K,_V,_I} ->
 2748:                          F(N-1)
 2749:                  catch error:badarg ->
 2750:                          F(N-1)
 2751:                  end
 2752:          end)(16#FFFF),
 2753: 
 2754:         ok
 2755:     after
 2756:             erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
 2757:     end.
 2758: 
 2759: verify_iterator(Map) ->
 2760:     KVs = t_fold(fun(K, V, A) -> [{K, V} | A] end, [], Map),
 2761: 
 2762:     %% Verify that KVs created by iterating Map is of
 2763:     %% correct size and contains all elements
 2764:     true = length(KVs) == maps:size(Map),
 2765:     [maps:get(K, Map) || {K, _} <- KVs],
 2766:     ok.
 2767: 
 2768: 
 2769: t_fold(Fun, Init, Map) ->
 2770:     t_fold_1(Fun, Init, maps:iterator(Map)).
 2771: 
 2772: t_fold_1(Fun, Acc, Iter) ->
 2773:     case maps:next(Iter) of
 2774:         {K, V, NextIter} ->
 2775:             t_fold_1(Fun, Fun(K,V,Acc), NextIter);
 2776:         none ->
 2777:             Acc
 2778:     end.
 2779: 
 2780: t_bif_build_and_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2781:     ok = check_build_and_remove(750,[fun(K) -> [K,K] end,
 2782: 				     fun(K) -> [float(K),K] end,
 2783: 				     fun(K) -> K end,
 2784: 				     fun(K) -> {1,K} end,
 2785: 				     fun(K) -> {K} end,
 2786: 				     fun(K) -> [K|K] end,
 2787: 				     fun(K) -> [K,1,2,3,4] end,
 2788: 				     fun(K) -> {K,atom} end,
 2789: 				     fun(K) -> float(K) end,
 2790: 				     fun(K) -> integer_to_list(K) end,
 2791: 				     fun(K) -> list_to_atom(integer_to_list(K)) end,
 2792: 				     fun(K) -> [K,{K,[K,{K,[K]}]}] end,
 2793: 				     fun(K) -> <<K:32>> end]),
 2794:     ok.
 2795: 
 2796: check_build_and_remove(_,[]) -> ok;
 2797: check_build_and_remove(N,[F|Fs]) ->
 2798:     {M,Ks} = build_and_check(N, maps:new(), F, []),
 2799:     ok     = remove_and_check(Ks,M),
 2800:     check_build_and_remove(N,Fs).
 2801: 
 2802: build_and_check(0, M0, _, Ks) -> {M0, Ks};
 2803: build_and_check(N, M0, F, Ks) ->
 2804:     K  = build_key(F,N),
 2805:     M1 = maps:put(K,K,M0),
 2806:     ok = check_keys_exist([I||{I,_} <- [{K,M1}|Ks]], M1),
 2807:     M2 = maps:update(K,v,M1),
 2808:     v  = maps:get(K,M2),
 2809:     build_and_check(N-1,M1,F,[{K,M1}|Ks]).
 2810: 
 2811: remove_and_check([],_) -> ok;
 2812: remove_and_check([{K,Mc}|Ks], M0) ->
 2813:     K     = maps:get(K,M0),
 2814:     true  = maps:is_key(K,M0),
 2815:     true  = Mc =:= M0,
 2816:     true  = M0 == Mc,
 2817:     M1    = maps:remove(K,M0),
 2818:     false = M1 =:= Mc,
 2819:     false = Mc == M1,
 2820:     false = maps:is_key(K,M1),
 2821:     true  = maps:is_key(K,M0),
 2822:     ok    = check_keys_exist([I||{I,_} <- Ks],M1),
 2823:     error = maps:find(K,M1),
 2824:     remove_and_check(Ks, M1).
 2825: 
 2826: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 0 -> F(N);
 2827: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 1 -> K = F(N), {K,K};
 2828: build_key(F,N) when N rem 3 =:= 2 -> K = F(N), [K,K].
 2829: 
 2830: check_keys_exist([], _) -> ok;
 2831: check_keys_exist([K|Ks],M) ->
 2832:     true = maps:is_key(K,M),
 2833:     check_keys_exist(Ks,M).
 2834: 
 2835: t_bif_merge_and_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2836: 
 2837:     io:format("rand:export_seed() -> ~p\n",[rand:export_seed()]),
 2838: 
 2839:     %% simple disjunct ones
 2840:     %% make sure all keys are unique
 2841:     Kss = [[a,b,c,d],
 2842: 	   [1,2,3,4],
 2843: 	   [],
 2844: 	   ["hi"],
 2845: 	   [e],
 2846: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> {small,K} end, I) || I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2847: 	   lists:seq(5, 28),
 2848: 	   lists:seq(29, 59),
 2849: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> integer_to_list(K) end, I) || I <- lists:seq(2000,10000)],
 2850: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> <<K:32>> end, I) || I <- lists:seq(1,80)],
 2851: 	   [build_key(fun(K) -> {<<K:32>>} end, I) || I <- lists:seq(100,1000)]],
 2852: 
 2853: 
 2854:     KsMs = build_keys_map_pairs(Kss),
 2855:     Cs   = [{CKs1,CM1,CKs2,CM2} || {CKs1,CM1} <- KsMs, {CKs2,CM2} <- KsMs],
 2856:     ok   = merge_and_check_combo(Cs),
 2857: 
 2858:     %% overlapping ones
 2859: 
 2860:     KVs1 = [{a,1},{b,2},{c,3}],
 2861:     KVs2 = [{b,3},{c,4},{d,5}],
 2862:     KVs  = [{I,I} || I <- lists:seq(1,32)],
 2863:     KVs3 = KVs1 ++ KVs,
 2864:     KVs4 = KVs2 ++ KVs,
 2865: 
 2866:     M1  = maps:from_list(KVs1),
 2867:     M2  = maps:from_list(KVs2),
 2868:     M3  = maps:from_list(KVs3),
 2869:     M4  = maps:from_list(KVs4),
 2870: 
 2871:     M12 = maps:merge(M1,M2),
 2872:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs2 ++ [{a,1}], M12),
 2873:     M21 = maps:merge(M2,M1),
 2874:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs1 ++ [{d,5}], M21),
 2875: 
 2876:     M34 = maps:merge(M3,M4),
 2877:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs4 ++ [{a,1}], M34),
 2878:     M43 = maps:merge(M4,M3),
 2879:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs3 ++ [{d,5}], M43),
 2880: 
 2881:     M14 = maps:merge(M1,M4),
 2882:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs4 ++ [{a,1}], M14),
 2883:     M41 = maps:merge(M4,M1),
 2884:     ok  = check_key_values(KVs1 ++ [{d,5}] ++ KVs, M41),
 2885: 
 2886:     [begin Ma = random_map(SzA, a),
 2887: 	   Mb = random_map(SzB, b),
 2888: 	   ok = merge_maps(Ma, Mb)
 2889:      end || SzA <- [3,10,20,100,200,1000], SzB <- [3,10,20,100,200,1000]],
 2890: 
 2891:     ok.
 2892: 
 2893: % Generate random map with an average of Sz number of pairs: K -> {V,K}
 2894: random_map(Sz, V) ->
 2895:     random_map_insert(#{}, 0, V, Sz*2).
 2896: 
 2897: random_map_insert(M0, K0, _, Sz) when K0 > Sz ->
 2898:     M0;
 2899: random_map_insert(M0, K0, V, Sz) ->
 2900:     Key = K0 + rand:uniform(3),
 2901:     random_map_insert(M0#{Key => {V,Key}}, Key, V, Sz).
 2902: 
 2903: 
 2904: merge_maps(A, B) ->
 2905:     AB = maps:merge(A, B),
 2906:     %%io:format("A=~p\nB=~p\n",[A,B]),
 2907:     maps_foreach(fun(K,VB) -> VB = maps:get(K, AB)
 2908: 		 end, B),
 2909:     maps_foreach(fun(K,VA) ->
 2910: 			 case {maps:get(K, AB),maps:find(K, B)} of
 2911: 			     {VA, error} -> ok;
 2912: 			     {VB, {ok, VB}} -> ok
 2913: 			 end
 2914: 		 end, A),
 2915: 
 2916:     maps_foreach(fun(K,V) ->
 2917: 			 case {maps:find(K, A),maps:find(K, B)} of
 2918: 			     {{ok, V}, error} -> ok;
 2919: 			     {error, {ok, V}} -> ok;
 2920: 			     {{ok,_}, {ok, V}} -> ok
 2921: 			 end
 2922: 		 end, AB),
 2923:     ok.
 2924: 
 2925: maps_foreach(Fun, Map) ->
 2926:     maps:fold(fun(K,V,_) -> Fun(K,V) end, void, Map).
 2927: 
 2928: 
 2929: check_key_values([],_) -> ok;
 2930: check_key_values([{K,V}|KVs],M) ->
 2931:     V = maps:get(K,M),
 2932:     check_key_values(KVs,M).
 2933: 
 2934: merge_and_check_combo([]) -> ok;
 2935: merge_and_check_combo([{Ks1,M1,Ks2,M2}|Cs]) ->
 2936:     M12 = maps:merge(M1,M2),
 2937:     ok  = check_keys_exist(Ks1 ++ Ks2, M12),
 2938:     M21 = maps:merge(M2,M1),
 2939:     ok  = check_keys_exist(Ks1 ++ Ks2, M21),
 2940: 
 2941:     true = M12 =:= M21,
 2942:     M12  = M21,
 2943: 
 2944:     merge_and_check_combo(Cs).
 2945: 
 2946: build_keys_map_pairs([]) -> [];
 2947: build_keys_map_pairs([Ks|Kss]) ->
 2948:     M  = maps:from_list(keys_to_pairs(Ks)),
 2949:     ok = check_keys_exist(Ks, M),
 2950:     [{Ks,M}|build_keys_map_pairs(Kss)].
 2951: 
 2952: keys_to_pairs(Ks) -> [{K,K} || K <- Ks].
 2953: 
 2954: 
 2955: %% Maps module, not BIFs
 2956: t_maps_fold(_Config) ->
 2957:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2958:     M  = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-Vs]),
 2959: 
 2960:     %% fold
 2961:     5050 = maps:fold(fun({k,_},{v,V},A) -> V + A end, 0, M),
 2962: 
 2963:     ok.
 2964: 
 2965: t_maps_map(_Config) ->
 2966:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2967:     M1 = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-Vs]),
 2968:     M2 = maps:from_list([{I,{token,I}}||I<-Vs]),
 2969: 
 2970:     M2 = maps:map(fun(_K,V) -> {token,V} end, M1),
 2971:     ok.
 2972: 
 2973: t_maps_size(_Config) ->
 2974:     Vs = lists:seq(1,100),
 2975:     lists:foldl(fun(I,M) ->
 2976: 		M1 = maps:put(I,I,M),
 2977: 		I  = maps:size(M1),
 2978: 		M1
 2979: 	end, #{}, Vs),
 2980:     ok.
 2981: 
 2982: 
 2983: t_maps_without(_Config) ->
 2984:     Ki = [11,22,33,44,55,66,77,88,99],
 2985:     M0 = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-lists:seq(1,100)]),
 2986:     M1 = maps:from_list([{{k,I},{v,I}}||I<-lists:seq(1,100) -- Ki]),
 2987:     M1 = maps:without([{k,I}||I <- Ki],M0),
 2988:     ok.
 2989: 
 2990: 
 2991: %% MISC
 2992: 
 2993: %% Verify that the number of nodes in hashmaps
 2994: %% of different types and sizes does not deviate too
 2995: %% much from the theoretical model.
 2996: %% For debug with DBG_HASHMAP_COLLISION_BONANZA the test will expect
 2997: %% the hashmaps to NOT be well balanced.
 2998: t_hashmap_balance(_Config) ->
 2999:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3000:     ExpectBalance = not erts_debug:get_internal_state(hashmap_collision_bonanza),
 3001:     hashmap_balance(ExpectBalance),
 3002:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
 3003:     ok.
 3004: 
 3005: hashmap_balance(EB) ->
 3006:     io:format("Integer keys\n", []),
 3007:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> I end, EB),
 3008:     io:format("Float keys\n", []),
 3009:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> float(I) end, EB),
 3010:     io:format("String keys\n", []),
 3011:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> integer_to_list(I) end, EB),
 3012:     io:format("Binary (big) keys\n", []),
 3013:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> <<I:16/big>> end, EB),
 3014:     io:format("Binary (little) keys\n", []),
 3015:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> <<I:16/little>> end, EB),
 3016:     io:format("Atom keys\n", []),
 3017:     hashmap_balance(fun(I) -> erts_debug:get_internal_state({atom,I}) end, EB),
 3018:     ok.
 3019: 
 3020: hashmap_balance(KeyFun, ExpectBalance) ->
 3021:     %% For uniformly distributed hash values, the average number of nodes N
 3022:     %% in a hashmap varies between 0.3*K and 0.4*K where K is number of keys.
 3023:     %% The standard deviation of N is about sqrt(K)/3.
 3024: 
 3025:     %% For simplicity we use the higher expected average 0.4*K
 3026:     %% and verfies that no map is too many standard deviation above it.
 3027: 
 3028:     F = fun(I, {M0,Max0}) ->
 3029: 		Key = KeyFun(I),
 3030: 		M1 = M0#{Key => Key},
 3031: 		Max1 = case erts_internal:term_type(M1) of
 3032: 			   hashmap ->
 3033: 			       Nodes = hashmap_nodes(M1),
 3034: 			       Avg = maps:size(M1) * 0.4,
 3035: 			       StdDev = math:sqrt(maps:size(M1)) / 3,
 3036: 			       SD_diff = abs(Nodes - Avg) / StdDev,
 3037: 			       %%io:format("~p keys: ~p nodes avg=~p SD_diff=~p\n",
 3038: 			       %%          [maps:size(M1), Nodes, Avg, SD_diff]),
 3039: 			       {MaxDiff0, _, Cnt} = Max0,
 3040: 			       case {Nodes > Avg, SD_diff > MaxDiff0} of
 3041: 				   {true, true} -> {SD_diff, M1, Cnt+1};
 3042: 				   _ -> Max0
 3043: 			       end;
 3044: 
 3045: 			   flatmap -> Max0
 3046: 		       end,
 3047: 		{M1, Max1}
 3048: 	end,
 3049: 
 3050:     {_,{MaxDiff,MaxMap, FatCnt}} = lists:foldl(F,
 3051: 					       {#{}, {0, undefined, 0}},
 3052: 					       lists:seq(1,10000)),
 3053:     case MaxMap of
 3054: 	undefined ->
 3055: 	    io:format("Wow, no map with more than \"average\" number of nodes\n");
 3056: 	_ ->
 3057: 	    io:format("Found ~p maps with more than \"average\" number of nodes\n",
 3058: 		      [FatCnt]),
 3059: 	    io:format("Max std dev diff ~p for map of size ~p (nodes=~p, flatsize=~p)\n",
 3060: 		      [MaxDiff, maps:size(MaxMap), hashmap_nodes(MaxMap),
 3061: 		       erts_debug:flat_size(MaxMap)])
 3062:     end,
 3063: 
 3064:     %% The probability of this line failing is about 0.000000001
 3065:     %% for a uniform hash. I've set the probability this "high" for now
 3066:     %% to detect flaws in our make_internal_hash.
 3067:     ExpectBalance = (MaxDiff < 6),
 3068:     ok.
 3069: 
 3070: hashmap_nodes(M) ->
 3071:     Info = erts_debug:map_info(M),
 3072:     lists:foldl(fun(Tpl,Acc) ->
 3073: 			case element(1,Tpl) of
 3074: 			    bitmaps -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 3075: 			    arrays -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 3076: 			    collisions -> Acc + element(2,Tpl);
 3077: 			    _ -> Acc
 3078: 			end
 3079: 		end,
 3080: 		0,
 3081: 		Info).
 3082: 
 3083: t_erts_internal_order(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3084: 
 3085:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,2),
 3086:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2,1),
 3087:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2,2),
 3088: 
 3089: 
 3090:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,a),
 3091:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,1),
 3092:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,a),
 3093: 
 3094:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,1.0),
 3095:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1.0,1),
 3096:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1.0,1.0),
 3097: 
 3098:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,1 bsl 65),
 3099:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65,1),
 3100:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65, 1 bsl 65),
 3101: 
 3102:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1 bsl 65,float(1)),
 3103:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1),1 bsl 65),
 3104:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(1,float(1 bsl 65)),
 3105:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1 bsl 65),1),
 3106:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(float(1 bsl 65), float(1 bsl 65)),
 3107: 
 3108:     %% reported errors
 3109:     -1 = erts_internal:cmp_term(0,2147483648),
 3110:     0  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2147483648,2147483648),
 3111:     1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(2147483648,0),
 3112: 
 3113:     %% Make sure it's not the internal flatmap order
 3114:     %% where low indexed 'true' < 'a'.
 3115:     -1  = erts_internal:cmp_term(a,true),
 3116: 
 3117:     M = #{0 => 0,2147483648 => 0},
 3118:     true = M =:= binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M)),
 3119:     true = M =:= binary_to_term(term_to_binary(M, [deterministic])),
 3120: 
 3121:     F1 = fun(_, _) -> 0 end,
 3122:     F2 = fun(_, _) -> 1 end,
 3123:     M0 = maps:from_list( [{-2147483649, 0}, {0,0}, {97, 0}, {false, 0}, {flower, 0}, {F1, 0}, {F2, 0}, {<<>>, 0}]),
 3124:     M1 = maps:merge(M0, #{0 => 1}),
 3125:     8  = maps:size(M1),
 3126:     1  = maps:get(0,M1),
 3127:     ok.
 3128: 
 3129: t_erts_internal_hash(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
 3130:     K1 = 0.0,
 3131:     K2 = 0.0/-1,
 3132:     M  = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-lists:seq(1,32)]),
 3133: 
 3134:     M1 = M#{ K1 => a, K2 => b },
 3135:     b  = maps:get(K2,M1),
 3136: 
 3137:     M2 = M#{ K2 => a, K1 => b },
 3138:     b  = maps:get(K1,M2),
 3139: 
 3140:     %% test previously faulty hash list optimization
 3141: 
 3142:     M3 = M#{[0] => a, [0,0] => b, [0,0,0] => c, [0,0,0,0] => d},
 3143:     a  = maps:get([0],M3),
 3144:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M3),
 3145:     c  = maps:get([0,0,0],M3),
 3146:     d  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M3),
 3147: 
 3148:     M4 = M#{{[0]} => a, {[0,0]} => b, {[0,0,0]} => c, {[0,0,0,0]} => d},
 3149:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M4),
 3150:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M4),
 3151:     c  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M4),
 3152:     d  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M4),
 3153: 
 3154:     M5 = M3#{[0,0,0] => e, [0,0,0,0] => f, [0,0,0,0,0] => g,
 3155:              [0,0,0,0,0,0] => h, [0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => i,
 3156:              [0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => j, [0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0] => k},
 3157: 
 3158:     a  = maps:get([0],M5),
 3159:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M5),
 3160:     e  = maps:get([0,0,0],M5),
 3161:     f  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M5),
 3162:     g  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3163:     h  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3164:     i  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3165:     j  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3166:     k  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M5),
 3167: 
 3168:     M6 = M4#{{[0,0,0]} => e, {[0,0,0,0]} => f, {[0,0,0,0,0]} => g,
 3169:              {[0,0,0,0,0,0]} => h, {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => i,
 3170:              {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => j, {[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]} => k},
 3171: 
 3172:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M6),
 3173:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M6),
 3174:     e  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M6),
 3175:     f  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3176:     g  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3177:     h  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3178:     i  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3179:     j  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3180:     k  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M6),
 3181: 
 3182:     M7 = maps:merge(M5,M6),
 3183: 
 3184:     a  = maps:get([0],M7),
 3185:     b  = maps:get([0,0],M7),
 3186:     e  = maps:get([0,0,0],M7),
 3187:     f  = maps:get([0,0,0,0],M7),
 3188:     g  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3189:     h  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3190:     i  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3191:     j  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3192:     k  = maps:get([0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0],M7),
 3193:     a  = maps:get({[0]},M7),
 3194:     b  = maps:get({[0,0]},M7),
 3195:     e  = maps:get({[0,0,0]},M7),
 3196:     f  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3197:     g  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3198:     h  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3199:     i  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3200:     j  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3201:     k  = maps:get({[0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]},M7),
 3202: 
 3203:     %% Test that external pids and ports don't introduce hash clash,
 3204:     %% caused by high word being ignored (OTP-17436).
 3205:     maps:from_keys([erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({a@a, 17},
 3206: 					       1 bsl NumBit,
 3207: 					       1 bsl SerBit)
 3208: 		    || NumBit <- lists:seq(0, 31),
 3209: 		       SerBit <- lists:seq(0, 31)],
 3210: 		   1),
 3211:     maps:from_keys([erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({a@a, 17}, 1 bsl NumBit)
 3212: 		    || NumBit <- lists:seq(0, 63)],
 3213: 		   1),
 3214: 
 3215:     ok.

 3217: t_pdict(_Config) ->

 3219:     put(#{ a => b, b => a},#{ c => d}),
 3220:     put(get(#{ a => b, b => a}),1),
 3221:     1 = get(#{ c => d}),
 3222:     #{ c := d } = get(#{ a => b, b => a}).

 3224: t_ets(_Config) ->
 3225: 
 3226:     Tid = ets:new(map_table,[]),
 3227: 
 3228:     [ets:insert(Tid,{maps:from_list([{I,-I}]),I}) || I <- lists:seq(1,100)],
 3229: 
 3230: 
 3231:     [{#{ 2 := -2},2}] = ets:lookup(Tid,#{ 2 => -2 }),
 3232: 
 3233:     %% Test equal
 3234:     [3,4] = lists:sort(
 3235: 	      ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','$2'},
 3236: 			       [{'or',{'==','$1',#{ 3 => -3 }},
 3237: 				 {'==','$1',#{ 4 => -4 }}}],
 3238: 			       ['$2']}])),
 3239:     %% Test match
 3240:     [30,50] = lists:sort(
 3241: 		ets:select(Tid,
 3242: 			   [{{#{ 30 => -30}, '$1'},[],['$1']},
 3243: 			    {{#{ 50 => -50}, '$1'},[],['$1']}]
 3244: 			  )),
 3245: 
 3246:     ets:insert(Tid,{#{ a => b, b => c, c => a},transitivity}),
 3247: 
 3248:     %% Test equal with map of different size
 3249:     [] = ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','_'},[{'==','$1',#{ b => c }}],['$_']}]),
 3250: 
 3251:     %% Test match with map of different size
 3252:     %[{#{ a := b },_}] = ets:select(Tid,[{{#{ b => c },'_'},[],['$_']}]),
 3253: 
 3254:     %%% Test match with don't care value
 3255:     %[{#{ a := b },_}] = ets:select(Tid,[{{#{ b => '_' },'_'},[],['$_']}]),
 3256: 
 3257:     %% Test is_map bif
 3258:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3259:     ets:insert(Tid,{not_a_map,2}),
 3260:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3261:     ets:insert(Tid,{{nope,a,tuple},2}),
 3262:     101 = length(ets:select(Tid,[{'$1',[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],['$1']}])),
 3263: 
 3264:     %% Test map_size bif
 3265:     [3] = ets:select(Tid,[{{'$1','_'},[{'==',{map_size,'$1'},3}],
 3266: 			   [{map_size,'$1'}]}]),
 3267: 
 3268:     true = ets:delete(Tid,#{50 => -50}),
 3269:     [] = ets:lookup(Tid,#{50 => -50}),
 3270: 
 3271:     ets:delete(Tid),
 3272:     ok.
 3273:

 3275:     ok.

 3277: t_tracing(_Config) ->
 3278: 
 3279:     dbg:stop(),
 3280:     {ok,Tracer} = dbg:tracer(process,{fun trace_collector/2, self()}),
 3281:     dbg:p(self(),c),
 3282: 
 3283:     %% Test basic map call
 3284:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,x),
 3285:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3286:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ a := b }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3287:     {trace,_,return_from,{?MODULE,id,1},#{ a := b }} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3288:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3289: 
 3290:     %% Test equals in argument list
 3291:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{'==','$1',#{ b => c}}],
 3292: 				  [{return_trace}]}]),
 3293:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3294:     id(#{ b => c }),
 3295:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ b := c }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3296:     {trace,_,return_from,{?MODULE,id,1},#{ b := c }} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3297:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3298: 
 3299:     %% Test match in head
 3300:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{[#{b => c}],[],[]}]),
 3301:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3302:     id(#{ b => c }),
 3303:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ b := c }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3304:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3305: 
 3306:     % Test map guard bifs
 3307:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{is_map,{element,1,'$1'}}],[]}]),
 3308:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3309:     id({1,2}),
 3310:     id({#{ a => b},2}),
 3311:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[{#{ a := b },2}]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3312:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3313: 
 3314:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,[{['$1'],[{'==',{map_size,{element,1,'$1'}},2}],[]}]),
 3315:     id(#{ a => b }),
 3316:     id({1,2}),
 3317:     id({#{ a => b},2}),
 3318:     id({#{ a => b, b => c},atom}),
 3319:     {trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[{#{ a := b, b := c },atom}]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3320:     dbg:ctpl(),
 3321: 
 3322:     %MS = dbg:fun2ms(fun([A]) when A == #{ a => b} -> ok end),
 3323:     %dbg:tpl(?MODULE,id,MS),
 3324:     %id(#{ a => b }),
 3325:     %id(#{ b => c }),
 3326:     %{trace,_,call,{?MODULE,id,[#{ a := b }]}} = getmsg(Tracer),
 3327:     %dbg:ctpl(),
 3328: 
 3329:     %% Check to extra messages
 3330:     timeout = getmsg(Tracer),
 3331: 
 3332:     dbg:stop(),
 3333:     ok.
 3334: 
 3335: getmsg(_Tracer) ->
 3336:     receive V -> V after 100 -> timeout end.
 3337: 
 3338: trace_collector(Msg,Parent) ->
 3339:     io:format("~p~n",[Msg]),
 3340:     Parent ! Msg,
 3341:     Parent.
 3342: 
 3343: t_has_map_fields(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3344:     true = has_map_fields_1(#{one=>1}),
 3345:     true = has_map_fields_1(#{one=>1,two=>2}),
 3346:     false = has_map_fields_1(#{two=>2}),
 3347:     false = has_map_fields_1(#{}),
 3348: 
 3349:     true = has_map_fields_2(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3}),
 3350:     true = has_map_fields_2(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3,x=>42}),
 3351:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{b=>2,c=>1}),
 3352:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{x=>y}),
 3353:     false = has_map_fields_2(#{}),
 3354: 
 3355:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3}),
 3356:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{c=>1,b=>2,a=>3,[]=>42}),
 3357:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{b=>2,a=>3,[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3358:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{a=>3,[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3359:     true = has_map_fields_3(#{[]=>42,42.0=>43}),
 3360:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{b=>2,c=>1}),
 3361:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{[]=>y}),
 3362:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{42.0=>x,a=>99}),
 3363:     false = has_map_fields_3(#{}),
 3364: 
 3365:     ok.
 3366: 
 3367: has_map_fields_1(#{one:=_}) -> true;
 3368: has_map_fields_1(#{}) -> false.
 3369: 
 3370: has_map_fields_2(#{a:=_,b:=_,c:=_}) -> true;
 3371: has_map_fields_2(#{}) -> false.
 3372: 
 3373: has_map_fields_3(#{a:=_,b:=_}) -> true;
 3374: has_map_fields_3(#{[]:=_,42.0:=_}) -> true;
 3375: has_map_fields_3(#{}) -> false.
 3376: 
 3377: t_get_map_elements(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3378:     %% Tests that the JIT implementation of `get_map_elements` handles
 3379:     %% collisions properly.
 3380:     N = 500000,
 3381:     Is = lists:seq(1, N),
 3382:     Test = maps:from_list([{I,I}||I<-Is]),
 3383:     [begin
 3384:          #{ Key := Val } = Test,
 3385:          Key = Val
 3386:      end || Key <- Is],
 3387: 
 3388:     ok.

 3390: y_regs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3391:     Val = [length(Config)],
 3392:     Map0 = y_regs_update(#{}, Val),
 3393:     Map2 = y_regs_update(Map0, Val),
 3394: 
 3395:     Map3 = maps:from_list([{I,I*I} || I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 3396:     Map4 = y_regs_update(Map3, Val),
 3397: 
 3398:     true = is_map(Map2) andalso is_map(Map4),
 3399: 
 3400:     gurka = y_regs_literal(0),
 3401:     gaffel = y_regs_literal(1),
 3402: 
 3403:     ok.
 3404: 
 3405: y_regs_literal(Key) when is_integer(Key) ->
 3406:     %% Forces the key to be placed in a Y register.
 3407:     lists:seq(1, 2),
 3408:     case is_map_key(Key, #{ 0 => 0 }) of
 3409:         true -> gurka;
 3410:         false -> gaffel
 3411:     end.
 3412: 
 3413: y_regs_update(Map0, Val0) ->
 3414:     Val1 = {t,Val0},
 3415:     K1 = id({key,1}),
 3416:     K2 = id({key,2}),
 3417:     Map1 = Map0#{K1=>K1,
 3418: 		 a=>Val0,b=>Val0,c=>Val0,d=>Val0,e=>Val0,
 3419: 		 f=>Val0,g=>Val0,h=>Val0,i=>Val0,j=>Val0,
 3420: 		 k=>Val0,l=>Val0,m=>Val0,n=>Val0,o=>Val0,
 3421: 		 p=>Val0,q=>Val0,r=>Val0,s=>Val0,t=>Val0,
 3422: 		 u=>Val0,v=>Val0,w=>Val0,x=>Val0,y=>Val0,
 3423: 		 z=>Val0,
 3424: 		 aa=>Val0,ab=>Val0,ac=>Val0,ad=>Val0,ae=>Val0,
 3425: 		 af=>Val0,ag=>Val0,ah=>Val0,ai=>Val0,aj=>Val0,
 3426: 		 ak=>Val0,al=>Val0,am=>Val0,an=>Val0,ao=>Val0,
 3427: 		 ap=>Val0,aq=>Val0,ar=>Val0,as=>Val0,at=>Val0,
 3428: 		 au=>Val0,av=>Val0,aw=>Val0,ax=>Val0,ay=>Val0,
 3429: 		 az=>Val0,
 3430: 		 K2=>[a,b,c]},
 3431:     Map2 = Map1#{K1=>K1,
 3432: 		 a:=Val1,b:=Val1,c:=Val1,d:=Val1,e:=Val1,
 3433: 		 f:=Val1,g:=Val1,h:=Val1,i:=Val1,j:=Val1,
 3434: 		 k:=Val1,l:=Val1,m:=Val1,n:=Val1,o:=Val1,
 3435: 		 p:=Val1,q:=Val1,r:=Val1,s:=Val1,t:=Val1,
 3436: 		 u:=Val1,v:=Val1,w:=Val1,x:=Val1,y:=Val1,
 3437: 		 z:=Val1,
 3438: 		 aa:=Val1,ab:=Val1,ac:=Val1,ad:=Val1,ae:=Val1,
 3439: 		 af:=Val1,ag:=Val1,ah:=Val1,ai:=Val1,aj:=Val1,
 3440: 		 ak:=Val1,al:=Val1,am:=Val1,an:=Val1,ao:=Val1,
 3441: 		 ap:=Val1,aq:=Val1,ar:=Val1,as:=Val1,at:=Val1,
 3442: 		 au:=Val1,av:=Val1,aw:=Val1,ax:=Val1,ay:=Val1,
 3443: 		 az:=Val1,
 3444: 		 K2=>[a,b,c]},
 3445: 
 3446:     %% Traverse the maps to validate them.
 3447:     _ = erlang:phash2({Map1,Map2}, 100000),
 3448: 
 3449:     _ = id({K1,K2,Val0,Val1}),			%Force use of Y registers.
 3450:     Map2.
 3451: 
 3452: do_badmap(Test) ->
 3453:     Terms = [Test,fun erlang:abs/1,make_ref(),self(),0.0/id(-1),
 3454: 	     <<0:1024>>,<<1:1>>,<<>>,<<1,2,3>>,
 3455: 	     [],{a,b,c},[a,b],atom,10.0,42,(1 bsl 65) + 3],
 3456:     [Test(T) || T <- Terms].
 3457: 
 3458: %% Use this function to avoid compile-time evaluation of an expression.
 3459: id(I) -> I.
 3460: 
 3461: 
 3462: %% OTP-13763
 3463: t_hash_entropy(Config) when is_list(Config)  ->
 3464:     %% entropy bug in 18.3, 19.0
 3465:     M1 = maps:from_list([{#{"id" => I}, ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,50000)]),
 3466: 
 3467:     #{ #{"id" => 100} := ok,
 3468:        #{"id" => 200} := ok,
 3469:        #{"id" => 300} := ok,
 3470:        #{"id" => 400} := ok,
 3471:        #{"id" => 500} := ok,
 3472:        #{"id" => 600} := ok,
 3473:        #{"id" => 700} := ok,
 3474:        #{"id" => 800} := ok,
 3475:        #{"id" => 900} := ok,
 3476:        #{"id" => 25061} := ok,
 3477:        #{"id" => 39766} := ok } = M1,
 3478: 
 3479:     M0 = maps:from_list([{I,ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,33)]),
 3480:     M2 = maps:from_list([{M0#{"id" => I}, ok}||I <- lists:seq(1,50000)]),
 3481: 
 3482:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 100}, M2),
 3483:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 200}, M2),
 3484:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 300}, M2),
 3485:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 400}, M2),
 3486:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 500}, M2),
 3487:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 600}, M2),
 3488:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 700}, M2),
 3489:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 800}, M2),
 3490:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 900}, M2),
 3491:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 25061}, M2),
 3492:     ok = maps:get(M0#{"id" => 39766}, M2),
 3493:     ok.
 3494: 
 3495: %% OTP-13146
 3496: %% Provoke major GC with a lot of "fat" maps on external format in msg queue
 3497: %% causing heap fragments to be allocated.
 3498: t_gc_rare_map_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3499:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3500:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3501:     try
 3502: 	Echo = spawn_link(Node, fun Loop() -> receive {From,Msg} -> From ! Msg
 3503: 					      end,
 3504: 					      Loop()
 3505: 				end),
 3506: 	FatMap = fatmap(34),
 3507: 	false = (flatmap =:= erts_internal:term_type(FatMap)),
 3508: 
 3509: 	t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, fun() -> erlang:garbage_collect() end),
 3510: 
 3511: 	%% Repeat test for minor gc:
 3512: 	t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, fun() -> minor_collect() end),
 3513: 
 3514: 	unlink(Echo),
 3515: 
 3516: 	%% Test fatmap in exit signal
 3517: 	Exiter = spawn_link(Node, fun Loop() -> receive {_From,Msg} ->
 3518: 							"not_a_map" = Msg  % badmatch!
 3519: 						end,
 3520: 						Loop()
 3521: 				  end),
 3522: 	process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3523: 	Exiter ! {self(), FatMap},
 3524: 	{'EXIT', Exiter, {{badmatch,FatMap}, _}} = receive M -> M end,
 3525: 	ok
 3526: 
 3527:     after
 3528: 	process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 3529: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
 3530: 	peer:stop(Peer)
 3531:     end.
 3532: 
 3533: t_gc_rare_map_overflow_do(Echo, FatMap, GcFun) ->
 3534:     Master = self(),
 3535:     true = receive _M -> false after 0 -> true end,   % assert empty msg queue
 3536:     Echo ! {Master, token},
 3537:     repeat(1000, fun(_) -> Echo ! {Master, FatMap} end, void),
 3538: 
 3539:     timer:sleep(100),                % Wait for maps to arrive in our msg queue
 3540:     token = receive Tok -> Tok end,  % and provoke move from outer to inner msg queue
 3541: 
 3542:     %% Do GC that will "overflow" and create heap frags due to all the fat maps
 3543:     GcFun(),
 3544: 
 3545:     %% Now check that all maps in msg queueu are intact
 3546:     %% Will crash emulator in OTP-18.1
 3547:     repeat(1000, fun(_) -> FatMap = receive FM -> FM end end, void),
 3548:     ok.
 3549: 
 3550: minor_collect() ->
 3551:     Before = minor_gcs(),
 3552:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(force_gc, self()),
 3553:     erlang:yield(),
 3554:     After = minor_gcs(),
 3555:     io:format("minor_gcs: ~p -> ~p\n", [Before, After]).
 3556: 
 3557: minor_gcs() ->
 3558:     {garbage_collection, Info} = process_info(self(), garbage_collection),
 3559:     {minor_gcs, GCS} = lists:keyfind(minor_gcs, 1, Info),
 3560:     GCS.
 3561: 
 3562: %% Generate a map with N (or N+1) keys that has an abnormal heap demand.
 3563: %% Done by finding keys that collide in the first 32-bit hash.
 3564: fatmap(N) ->
 3565:     %%erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3566:     Table = ets:new(void, [bag, private]),
 3567: 
 3568:     Seed0 = rand:seed_s(exsplus, {4711, 3141592, 2718281}),
 3569:     Seed1 = fatmap_populate(Table, Seed0, (1 bsl 16)),
 3570:     Keys = fatmap_generate(Table, Seed1, N, []),
 3571:     ets:delete(Table),
 3572:     maps:from_list([{K,K} || K <- Keys]).
 3573: 
 3574: fatmap_populate(_, Seed, 0) -> Seed;
 3575: fatmap_populate(Table, Seed, N) ->
 3576:     {I, NextSeed} = rand:uniform_s(1 bsl 48, Seed),
 3577:     Hash = internal_hash(I),
 3578:     ets:insert(Table, [{Hash, I}]),
 3579:     fatmap_populate(Table, NextSeed, N-1).
 3580: 
 3581: 
 3582: fatmap_generate(_, _, N, Acc) when N =< 0 ->
 3583:     Acc;
 3584: fatmap_generate(Table, Seed, N0, Acc0) ->    
 3585:     {I, NextSeed} = rand:uniform_s(1 bsl 48, Seed),
 3586:     Hash = internal_hash(I),
 3587:     case ets:member(Table, Hash) of
 3588: 	true ->
 3589: 	    NewKeys = [I | ets:lookup_element(Table, Hash, 2)],
 3590: 	    Acc1 = lists:usort(Acc0 ++ NewKeys),
 3591: 	    N1 = N0 - (length(Acc1) - length(Acc0)),
 3592: 	    fatmap_generate(Table, NextSeed, N1, Acc1);
 3593: 	false ->
 3594: 	    fatmap_generate(Table, NextSeed, N0, Acc0)
 3595:     end.
 3596: 
 3597: internal_hash(Term) ->
 3598:     erts_debug:get_internal_state({internal_hash, Term}).
 3599: 
 3600: 
 3601: %% map external_format (fannerl).
 3602: fannerl() ->
 3603:     <<131,116,0,0,0,28,100,0,13,108,101,97,114,110,105,110,103,95,114,
 3604:       97,116,101,70,63,230,102,102,96,0,0,0,100,0,17,108,101,97,114,110,105,110,
 3605:       103,95,109,111,109,101,110,116,117,109,70,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,100,0,
 3606:       18,116,114,97,105,110,105,110,103,95,97,108,103,111,114,105,116,104,109,100,0,
 3607:       16,102,97,110,110,95,116,114,97,105,110,95,114,112,114,111,112,

 3678: 
 3679: %% This test case checks that the bug with ticket number OTP-15707 is
 3680: %% fixed. The bug could cause a crash or memory usage to grow until
 3681: %% the machine ran out of memory.
 3682: t_large_unequal_bins_same_hash_bug(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3683:     run_when_enough_resources(
 3684:       fun() ->
 3685:               K1 = get_4GB_bin(1),
 3686:               K2 = get_4GB_bin(2),
 3687:               Map = make_map(500),
 3688:               Map2 = maps:put(K1, 42, Map),
 3689:               %% The map needed to contain at least 32 key-value pairs
 3690:               %% at this point to get the crash or out of memory
 3691:               %% problem on the next line
 3692:               Map3 = maps:put(K2, 43, Map2),
 3693:               %% The following line should avoid that the compiler
 3694:               %% optimizes away the above
 3695:               io:format("~p ~p~n", [erlang:phash2(Map3), maps:size(Map3)])
 3696:       end).
 3697: 
 3698: 
 3699: 
 3700: make_map(0) -> 
 3701:     #{};
 3702: make_map(Size) ->
 3703:     maps:put(Size, Size, make_map(Size-1)).
 3704: 
 3705: get_4GB_bin(Value) ->
 3706:     List = lists:duplicate(65536, Value),
 3707:     Bin = erlang:iolist_to_binary(List),
 3708:     IOList4GB = duplicate_iolist(Bin, 16),
 3709:     Bin4GB = erlang:iolist_to_binary(IOList4GB),
 3710:     4294967296 = size(Bin4GB),
 3711:     Bin4GB.
 3712: 
 3713: duplicate_iolist(IOList, 0) ->
 3714:     IOList;
 3715: duplicate_iolist(IOList, NrOfTimes) ->
 3716:     duplicate_iolist([IOList, IOList], NrOfTimes - 1).
 3717: 
 3718: run_when_enough_resources(Fun) ->
 3719:     case {total_memory(), erlang:system_info(wordsize)} of
 3720:         {Mem, 8} when is_integer(Mem) andalso Mem >= 31 ->
 3721:             Fun();
 3722:         {Mem, WordSize} ->
 3723:             {skipped, 
 3724:              io_lib:format("Not enough resources (System Memory >= ~p, Word Size = ~p)",
 3725:                            [Mem, WordSize])}
 3726:     end.
 3727: 
 3728: total_memory() ->
 3729:     %% Total memory in GB.
 3730:     try
 3731: 	SMD = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
 3732:         TM = proplists:get_value(
 3733:                available_memory, SMD,
 3734:                proplists:get_value(
 3735:                  total_memory, SMD,
 3736:                  proplists:get_value(
 3737:                    system_total_memory, SMD))),
 3738:         TM div (1024*1024*1024)
 3739:     catch
 3740: 	_ : _ ->
 3741: 	    undefined
 3742:     end.
 3743: 
 3744: %% This test case checks that maps larger than 32 elements are readable
 3745: %% when displayed.
 3746: t_map_display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3747:     verify_map_term(make_nontrivial_map(33)),
 3748:     verify_map_term(make_nontrivial_map(253)),
 3749:     verify_map_term({a, make_nontrivial_map(77)}),
 3750:     verify_map_term([make_nontrivial_map(42),
 3751:                      {a,make_nontrivial_map(99)},
 3752:                      make_nontrivial_map(77)]),
 3753: 
 3754:     ok.
 3755: 
 3756: make_nontrivial_map(N) ->
 3757:     make_nontrivial_map(N, 32).
 3758: 
 3759: make_nontrivial_map(N, Effort) ->
 3760:     L = [begin
 3761:              Key = case I rem 64 of
 3762:                        33 when Effort > 16 ->
 3763:                            make_nontrivial_map(I, Effort div 2);
 3764:                        _ ->
 3765:                            I
 3766:                    end,
 3767:              Value = case I rem 5 of
 3768:                          0 ->
 3769:                              I * I;
 3770:                          1 ->
 3771:                              if
 3772:                                  Effort > 16 ->
 3773:                                      make_nontrivial_map(33, Effort div 2);
 3774:                                  true ->
 3775:                                      make_map(Effort)
 3776:                              end;
 3777:                          2 ->
 3778:                              lists:seq(0, I rem 16);
 3779:                          3 ->
 3780:                              list_to_tuple(lists:seq(0, I rem 16));
 3781:                          4 ->
 3782:                              float(I)
 3783:                      end,
 3784:              {Key, Value}
 3785:          end || I <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 3786:     maps:from_list(L).
 3787: 
 3788: verify_map_term(Term) ->
 3789:     Printed = string:chomp(erts_internal:term_to_string(Term)),
 3790:     {ok,Tokens,1} = erl_scan:string(Printed ++ "."),
 3791:     {ok,ParsedTerm} = erl_parse:parse_term(Tokens),
 3792: 
 3793:     case ParsedTerm of
 3794:         Term ->
 3795:             ok;
 3796:         Other ->
 3797:             io:format("Expected:\n~p\n", [Term]),
 3798:             io:format("Got:\n~p", [Other]),
 3799:             ct:fail(failed)
 3800:     end.
 3801: 
 3802: %%%
 3803: %%% Benchmarks
 3804: %%%
 3805: 
 3806: -define(SMALL_MAP_SIZE, 32).
 3807: -define(BIG_MAP_SIZE, 3333).
 3808: 
 3809: benchmarks(_Config) ->
 3810:     N = 5000000,
 3811: 
 3812:     %% Looks up a known value in a flatmap and (relatively large) hashmap,
 3813:     %% the value will be near the middle of the tested flatmap in an
 3814:     %% attempt to make the test more representative.
 3815:     lookup_literal_immed_small(N),
 3816:     lookup_literal_immed_big(N),
 3817: 
 3818:     %% Looks up a value that _COULD_ be an immediate (and always is in this
 3819:     %% test), benchmarking the common case of looking up an unknown integer
 3820:     %% or similar.
 3821:     %%
 3822:     %% Like literal_immed_small, we try to pick a value that will be in the
 3823:     %% middle of the tested flatmap.
 3824:     lookup_any_immed_small(N),
 3825:     lookup_any_immed_big(N),
 3826: 
 3827:     %% Looks up `[{}]`, looking for regressions in pre-hashed complex
 3828:     %% lookups.
 3829:     lookup_literal_complex_small(N),
 3830:     lookup_literal_complex_big(N),
 3831: 
 3832:     %% Looks up some unknown complex term, looking for regressions in complex
 3833:     %% lookups that need to be hashed in runtime. 
 3834:     lookup_any_complex_small(N),
 3835:     lookup_any_complex_big(N),
 3836: 
 3837:     %% Looks up a bunch of keys in parallel, benchmarking maps-as-structs.
 3838:     lookup_literal_multi_small(N),
 3839:     lookup_literal_multi_big(N),
 3840: 
 3841:     ok.
 3842: 
 3843: lookup_literal_immed_small(Iterations) ->
 3844:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3845:     F = fun(N) -> literal_immed(N, Map0, []) end,
 3846:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3847: 
 3848: lookup_literal_immed_big(Iterations) ->
 3849:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3850:     F = fun(N) -> literal_immed(N, Map0, []) end,
 3851:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3852: 
 3853: literal_immed(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3854:     Acc;
 3855: literal_immed(N, Map, _) ->
 3856:     #{ (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2) := Acc } = Map,
 3857:     literal_immed(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3858: 
 3859: lookup_any_immed_small(Iterations) ->
 3860:     Size = ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1,
 3861:     Map = maps:from_list([{V, -V} || V <- lists:seq(-Size, Size)]),
 3862:     F = fun(N) -> any_immed(N, Map, Size div 2) end,
 3863:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3864: 
 3865: lookup_any_immed_big(Iterations) ->
 3866:     Size = ?BIG_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1,
 3867:     Map = maps:from_list([{V, -V} || V <- lists:seq(-Size, Size)]),
 3868:     F = fun(N) -> any_immed(N, Map, Size div 2) end,
 3869:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3870: 
 3871: any_immed(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3872:     Acc;
 3873: any_immed(N, Map, Acc0) ->
 3874:     #{ Acc0 := Acc } = Map,
 3875:     any_immed(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3876: 
 3877: lookup_literal_complex_small(Iterations) ->
 3878:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3879:     F = fun(N) -> literal_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => [{}] }, [{}]) end,
 3880:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3881: 
 3882: lookup_literal_complex_big(Iterations) ->
 3883:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), []),
 3884:     F = fun(N) -> literal_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => [{}] }, [{}]) end,
 3885:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3886: 
 3887: literal_complex(0, Map, Acc) ->
 3888:     {Map, Acc};
 3889: literal_complex(N, Map, _) ->
 3890:     #{ [{}] := Acc } = Map,
 3891:     literal_complex(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3892: 
 3893: lookup_any_complex_small(Iterations) ->
 3894:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE - 2), []),
 3895:     F = fun(N) ->
 3896:                 any_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => {[]}, {[]} => [{}] }, [{}])
 3897:         end,
 3898:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3899: 
 3900: lookup_any_complex_big(Iterations) ->
 3901:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE - 2), []),
 3902:     F = fun(N) ->
 3903:                 any_complex(N, Map0#{ [{}] => {[]}, {[]} => [{}] }, [{}])
 3904:         end,
 3905:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3906: 
 3907: any_complex(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3908:     Acc;
 3909: any_complex(N, Map, Acc0) ->
 3910:     #{ Acc0 := Acc } = Map,
 3911:     any_complex(N - 1, Map, Acc).
 3912: 
 3913: lookup_literal_multi_small(Iterations) ->
 3914:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?SMALL_MAP_SIZE), id([])),
 3915:     F = fun(N) -> literal_multi(N, Map0, []) end,
 3916:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3917: 
 3918: lookup_literal_multi_big(Iterations) ->
 3919:     Map0 = maps:from_keys(lists:seq(1, ?BIG_MAP_SIZE), id([])),
 3920:     F = fun(N) -> literal_multi(N, Map0, []) end,
 3921:     time(?FUNCTION_NAME, F, Iterations).
 3922: 
 3923: literal_multi(0, _Map, Acc) ->
 3924:     Acc;
 3925: literal_multi(N, Map, _) ->
 3926:     #{ (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 0) := Same,
 3927:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 1) := Same,
 3928:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 1) := Same,
 3929:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 + 2) := Same,
 3930:        (?SMALL_MAP_SIZE div 2 - 2) := Same } = Map,
 3931:     literal_multi(N - 1, Map, Same).
 3932: 
 3933: time(Name, F, Iterations) ->
 3934:     Time = element(1, timer:tc(F, [Iterations])),
 3935:     ct_event:notify(#event{name=benchmark_data,
 3936:                            data=[{value, Time},
 3937:                                  {suite, ?MODULE_STRING},
 3938:                                  {name, atom_to_list(Name)}]}),
 3939:     Time.
